Crypto.description: I heard random isn't random enough, so i made it more random. So random in fact, not even the seeds can help you predict it.
Crypto.name: Unpredictable

Crypto.description: One of my friends is really into crypto. Not the "spend a years salary on funny monkey picture"-kind, the math thingy. He sent me a super strange text, can you help me decipher it? He said it's so easy, even people just carrying sticks and stones around would be able to decipher it.
Crypto.name: Simple Crypto

Crypto.description:
Just decrypt the flag.

---

**Hint:**

The concrete values of the matrices are crucial for exploitation. They were not chosen at random
Crypto.name: ChaCha60

Crypto.description: Mm friend is annoying me again. He sent me another strange picture and wants me to find it funny. He thinks it's cool making fun of me, just becuase i became a monk after school. (Flag-Format \"Glacier{...}\")
Crypto.name: Strange Letters

Crypto.description:
This store sells interesting things. It also uses a questionable checkout system.
Can you exploit it?
Crypto.name: CryptoShop

Hardware.description:
I built this amazing custom architecture, but my friends say it's too slow to get to big numbers.
Can you prove them wrong?
Hardware.name: StackMath

Misc.description: Last year i finally got to climb my first glacier. Look at how pretty my picture is.
Misc.name: The Climber

Misc.description:
This game is so hard, I've spent the last few weeks trying to beat it but i'm not able to 😦 Can you help me?

---
This challenge is sponsored by ITK Engineering GmbH


With over 1,200 employees, ITK Engineering GmbH is an international technology company with strong expertise in digitalisation, electrification, automation, security and networking of systems. Since 2017, the company has been a 100% subsidiary of Robert Bosch GmbH. With your strong innovative power, high quality standards and your passion for new technologies you’ll shape your future at a globally growing technology partner at ITK Engineering.  
Website:  www.bosch.at/en/careers/
![ITK_Logo_CMYK_100c70m20k.svg](/files/be05e94020e20c60f45e764ac7f04439/ITK_Logo_CMYK_100c70m20k.svg)

---
Misc.name: fuzzy_dungeon

Misc.description:
I wrote my own clipboard manager. It is very secure and that allows me to expose it to the internet without any risks.
My only problem is, that I have to copy the passwords with my passwordmanagers copy function.
Otherwise I cannot distinguish between passwords and text and the passwords will get stored normally.
I try not to forgett that...

---

**Hint:**

The flag is stored within memory. Play around with the program and try to find patterns within the listed entries. Brute force is not required and a waste of time.
Misc.name: ClipRip Stage 1

Misc.description:
This weird video seems to break my player.
Maybe there's a flag hidden somewhere.
Misc.name: Size Matters

PWN.description: Wrote a calculator in JavaScript as beginner project. It worked so well, that I decided to make it public available.
PWN.name: Break the Calculator

PWN.description:
I knew that I would make a mistake at some point and copy a password with Ctrl-c.
However, that one was to be expected and the application itself is secure.
All my user input is handled securely, i think.

(The files can be downloaded from the first stage challenge that's under Misc category)
PWN.name: ClipRip Stage 2

PWN.description: Some bins really do run fast...
PWN.name: old dayz

PWN.description: This one is too much even for most crypto people... can u still get it?
PWN.name: Filer

Rev.description: Someone put some super secret cipher inside this WebAssembly file. Can you reveal the secret key?
Rev.name: Wat's up

Rev.description:
Steves company has a custom service that executes binaries in a sandbox.
The admins changed his password though - can you still get in and leak theirs as revenge?
Rev.name: Sandboxer

Web.description:
It came to our attention that a highly advanced `APT` targeted our `edge computing system`. In order to stop the attacks, we implemented *even more advanced* mitigations.

Think `seccomp`, but for the `web`!

Now there's **no** way an attacker could run malicious code, right?

(Goal: Read `flag.txt` at the filesystem's root.)
Web.name: RCE as a Service (Stage 2)

Web.description:
Our new 110% legit cryptocurrency is so cool, it does not even use blockchains.
We have a WIP web interface for trading though. Hope nobody can get a beta testing account.
Web.name: FlagCoin Stage 1

Web.description:
The Top Glacier Blog provides you with the latest news from the community about a variety of topics. 
Wheter it is local news or global news, you are always up to date.
Web.name: Glacier Top News

Web.description:
Cloud computing is trending? Says your **grandpa**!

`Edge Computing` is the future! And the future is now. Today!

Give us a lambda and an array to operate on and our modern `.NET6`-powered backend will compute the results on an edge near your user in *no time*.

But please don't try to run custom code, because [this incident will be reported](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/incident.png).

(Goal: Read `flag.txt` at the filesystem's root.)
Web.name: RCE as a Service (Stage 1)
